availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Lexington, Kentucky, minister. Madison County, New York native. Son of Dr. Daniel Pratt and Sarah Rogers Hill Moody Pratt. Married to Julia Peck Pratt in New York on August 22, 1839. Married to Mary Ellis Dillard in Kentucky in 1846. Father of Laura, William Dudley, Mary Baldwin, Elizabeth, and Ryland Dillard Pratt. Attended Cazenovid and Hamilton Seminaries. Graduate of Madison University with a doctorate in divinity in 1856. Helped found First Baptist Church and Crawfordville Seminary in Crafordsville, Indiana in 1838. Baptist clergyman in Lexington, Kentucky in 1860.
